channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

DescribePack: The Plastic container inside had a loose cap causing a spill DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: place package in a Hazmat container to prevent further spillage

Transportation by road has been confirmed. Shipment also contains UN1266, Paint, Class 3 Single Package or Inner Packaging(if any): Packaging Type: Bottle Material of Construction: Glass Package Capacity: 10 mi Amount in Package: 10 mi Number in Shipment: 3 Number Failed: 3

item.title: Report E-2024010396
item.description:
Report E-2024010396

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-16
  • City: SELKIRK
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 01/16/24 at 08:55 hours, an FRA Hazardous Materials Inspector working in the CSX Selkirk Yard reported loaded tank car UTLX 209284, Alcohols NOS, leaking from the bottom outlet valve (BOV). The car was isolated and the shipper, Cargill, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report #2024-0116-0040). HEPACO, a CSX Emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and confirmed the initial report of a leaking BOV. Upon further inspection, it was determined product was leaking past the internal ball of the BOV due to a defective component. It was also noted that due to a deteriorated gasket, the BOV’s secondary closure cap was unable to contain the leak. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper-s representative- Daniel Gernant (303-709-1653, Daniel_Gernant@cargill.com). Contractor personnel installed a new gasket on the secondary closure cap to contain stop the release. The car was held at Selkirk pending transload of the contents and certified repair and/or OTMA.

item.title: Report X-2024020126
item.description:
Report X-2024020126

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-31
  • City: BROOKLYN
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024020126 PACKAGE WAS RETRIEVED FROM A PACKAGE CAR AND PLACED IN SPILL TRAY INSIDE DMP AREA. DURING INSPECTION RESPONDER DISCOVERED ONE OF THE FOUR BOTTLES WAS CRACKED. ANOTHER BOTTLE HAD A LOOSE CAP. RESPONDER PROCESSED THROUGH DMP. 2. X-2024020127 PACKAGE WAS RETREIVED FROM A PACKAGE CAR BY RESPONDER AND PLACED IN A SPILL TRAY INSIDE DMP AREA. RESPONDER DISCOVERED TWO OUT OF THE FOUR BOTTLES HAD LOOSE CAPS.
